titleStmt.title: The good wives fore-cast, or, The kind and loving mothers counsel to her daughter after marriage. My daughter dear I pray give ear, this lesson I have learn'd, I'll tell to you, you'l find it true, a penny sav'd, is earn'd. Tune of, Why are my eyes, still flow----ing. &c. This may be printed, R.P.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for J. Deacon at the Angel in Guilt-spur-street, without Newgate.,

notesStmt.note: Place and date of publication suggested by Wing.
Verse: "My daughter dear, now since you are become a bride ..."
Item at A5:2[153] imperfect: trimmed, affecting imprint.
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University, Houghton Library and the British Library.
